newsitem.title: UK: FKI up on strong H1 profit, dividend gains.
newsitem.headline: FKI up on strong H1 profit, dividend gains.

text.p: Shares in diversified engineering company FKI Plc rose on Wednesday on the back of a solid jump in its half year profits and dividend, analysts said.
The shares rose 3p at 201-1/2p by 1004 GMT in volume of 1.3 million shares.
"The shares are up because the results are positive and the numbers are slightly stronger than expected," said one analyst, who declined to be named.
FKI's six month pretax profit rose 30.5 percent to 51.4 million stg from 39.4 million stg in the same period last year.
The company raised its interim dividend to 3.1p per share versus 2.2p per share last year.

Chairman Jeff Whalley said in a statement accompanying the results that FKI was determined to continue its strategy of investment in new capital equipment, product development and further acquisitions.

"By investment in modern capital equipment we have revitalised many of our old-established businesses to the extent that we are now competing more successfully in our markets with lower cost, higher quality products," he said.
